definition: pincushion
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
penetrating (as of cold)/struggle
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)

sentences.english: Im going to put needles into certain points on your body.
sentences.chinese: 我把針扎到您身上的穴位中去。

sentences.english: Wait until a mosquito imbibe enough blood then punch a hole on its stomach by a needle.
sentences.chinese: 期望一隻蚊子吸飽了血，在它肚子上用針扎一個洞。

sentences.english: Feel like pins and needles, it was so cold.
sentences.chinese: 覺得像被針扎，那淚是如此的冰涼。

sentences.english: The gibe smarted in his brain.
sentences.chinese: 人家的嘲笑令他腦子針扎似地作痛。

sentences.english: The needle left a prick in the tailor's finger.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫的手指上有個針扎的孔。

sentences.english: Garrett Breedlove: Id rather stick needles in my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願自己的眼睛被針扎着。

sentences.english: I'm going to put needles into certin points on your body.
sentences.chinese: 我把針扎到您身上的穴位中去。

sentences.english: No. For the blood test, they cut my finger.
sentences.chinese: 不，驗血他們要用針扎我的手指頭。

sentences.english: He tried to needle me into losing my temper.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖用針扎我來激怒我。

definition: to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
bastard/scoundrel/rogue
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
summer sleeping mat (e.g. of woven split bamboo)/CL:張|张[zhang1],領|领[ling3]
nail clipper
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
neck
to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
band-aid
back of the head
with dishevelled hair (idiom)/with one's hair down
variant of 腳趾|脚趾[jiao3 zhi3]
